segments.en: Linked Discourses 4
2. Rule
17. The Six Fields of Contact

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṃ.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavā channaṃ phassāyatanānaṃ upādāya bhikkhūnaṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandasseti samādapeti samuttejeti sampahaṃseti.
segments.en: Now at that time the Buddha was educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the mendicants with a Dhamma talk on the topic of the six fields of contact.

segments.pli: Te ca bhikkhū aṭṭhiṃ katvā manasi katvā sabbacetasā samannāharitvā ohitasotā dhammaṃ suṇanti.
segments.en: And those mendicants were paying heed, paying attention, engaging wholeheartedly, and lending an ear.
Then Māra thought,

segments.pli: “ayaṃ kho samaṇo gotamo channaṃ phassāyatanānaṃ upādāya bhikkhūnaṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandasseti samādapeti samuttejeti sappahaṃseti.
segments.en: “This ascetic Gotama is educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the mendicants with a Dhamma talk on the topic of the six fields of contact.

segments.pli: Te ca bhikkhū aṭṭhiṃ katvā manasi katvā sabbacetasā samannāharitvā ohitasotā dhammaṃ suṇanti.
segments.en: And those mendicants are paying heed, paying attention, engaging wholeheartedly, and lending an ear.

segments.pli: Yannūnāhaṃ yena samaṇo gotamo tenupasaṅkameyyaṃ vicakkhukammāyā”ti.
segments.en: Why don’t I go and pull the wool over their eyes?”

segments.pli: Atha kho māro pāpimā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato avidūre mahantaṃ bhayabheravaṃ saddamakāsi, apissudaṃ pathavī maññe undrīyati. Atha kho aññataro bhikkhu aññataraṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Māra the Wicked went up to the Buddha and made a terrifyingly loud noise close by him. It seemed as if the earth were shattering, so that one of the mendicants said to another,
“Mendicant, mendicant, it seems like the earth is shattering!”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte, bhagavā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When this was said, the Buddha said to that mendicant,
“Mendicant, that’s not the earth shattering.

segments.pli: Māro eso pāpimā tumhākaṃ vicakkhukammāya āgato”ti.
segments.en: That’s Māra the Wicked come to pull the wool over your eyes!”

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā “māro ayaṃ pāpimā” iti viditvā māraṃ pāpimantaṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi:
segments.en: Then the Buddha, knowing that this was Māra the Wicked, addressed him in verse:
“Sights, sounds, tastes, smells,
touches, and thoughts, the lot of them—
this is the dreadful bait
that the world’s infatuated by.
But a mindful disciple of the Buddha
has transcended all that.
Having gone beyond Māra’s sovereignty,
they shine like the sun.”

segments.pli: Atha kho māro pāpimā … pe … tatthevantaradhāyīti.
segments.en: Then Māra … vanished right there.

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī,…

suttaplex.blurb: While the mendicants are listening to the teachings, Māra makes an awful roar to distract them.
